subject: Collect ramoops data into BMC dump
commitMessage:
Collect ramoops data into BMC dump

- Add ramoops file monitor and support to enable ramoops data
  collection for kernel dump.

- Systemd will collect ramoops data and write it into
  /var/lib/systemd/pstore when a system kernel oops/panics.

- Today, need to grab everything in that directory, put it in a dump
  and then delete everything in that directory.

Tested:
- Simulate a kernel panic by creating similar data in the expected
  location.
  `dmesg > /var/lib/systemd/pstore/dmesg1.txt`
  `dmesg > /var/lib/systemd/pstore/dmesg2.txt`
  `dmesg > /var/lib/systemd/pstore/dmesg3.txt`
  `dmesg > /var/lib/systemd/pstore/dmesg4.txt`

  tar -tvf obmcdump_1_248.tar.xz:

  drwxr-xr-x 0/0         0 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0     21239 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/dmesg1.txt
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0     21239 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/dmesg2.txt
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0     21239 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/dmesg3.txt
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0     21239 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/dmesg4.txt
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0       162 1970-01-01 00:01:32 obmcdump_1_248/dreport.log
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0       294 1970-01-01 00:01:31 obmcdump_1_248/os-release
  -rw-r--r-- 0/0       278 1970-01-01 00:01:31 obmcdump_1_248/summary.log

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I05bca408f4dcc2b62350104a0c5f757d740dde22

Patch Set 1:

Thanks for doing this George. One limitation I've seen in phosphor-debug-collector in the past is it does not pick up files if they exist already when the application starts. The watch logic detects new files but not files that already exist. Does this commit address this issue? ramoops data will always already be in there because of the nature of the kernel panic and BMC reboot.

Some issues are still unresolved from PS5. I also don't like that the new dump mode is called 'Ramoops', which is a specific kernel feature that is distinct from kdump. Both are used to collect data about kernel crashes, and we'll be moving to kdump once we have appropriate kexec support.

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as ff92ffe29db4099fa44864fc22f40843f4ca1834 by Jayanth Othayoth

ApplicationCored type is for creating Application core dump use case . In this type dreport ( packaging scripts) collects the data required to analyze the core dump. Please refer phosphor-debug-collector/tools/dreport.d/dreport file for details.

The design should be creating new dump type instead of using ApplicationCore type and add support in internal d-bus and dreport tool..

Also dump manager follows design s enble only required dumps.

Ramoops is an oops/panic logger that writes its logs to RAM before the system crashes.

add little bit about ramoops
iMgr also event parameter is missing
this can be fs::path as we are doing fs operations on this
ramoops?

My understanding is watch folder contain;s multiple files,. this file copying logic is good for copying all required files from the folder , i mean in the first IN_CLOSE_WRITE signal , all the required files are going to be availble in the folder?

Yes, like this:
```
# ls /var/lib/systemd/pstore/
console-ramoops-0  dmesg-ramoops-0    dmesg-ramoops-1    dmesg.txt
```

This does not trigger a kernel panic. Kernel panics are effectively a kernel segfault or equivalent where there's no possible recovery. Here you're just writing a file, presumably to trigger an inotify event or something?

Dump contents file names information is sufficient here.

This seems to be wrong, should be creating single dump with all the ramoops specific file. @andrew J . please confirm.  You may need to look the file watch logic. I have posted comment earlier related to watch logic.
This creates new dump request , you should trigger this requets only after all the required files available in the specific path.

https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-pstore.service.html
“The systemd-pstore executable does the actual work. Upon starting, the pstore.conf file is read and the /sys/fs/pstore/ directory contents are processed according to the options. Pstore files are written to the journal, and optionally saved into /var/lib/systemd/pstore/.” @andrewJ  based on this , the new ramps monitor service  should start  prior to systemd-pstore.service right?

> @andrewJ  based on this , the new ramps monitor service  should start  prior to systemd-pstore.service right?

How did you come to this conclusion? I think the ramoops support here should just look in /var/lib/systemd/pstore.

I don't think we should try to beat systemd-pstore at its own game.

when this app is going to trigger to collect dump?
 I think you can initiate this app during BMC boot path aftre dump manager started.
- App will create d-bus based dump request , if the file is available.
